metadata.synopsis: While she tries to determine her career goals, Iris (Toni Collette) becomes a temporary worker for Global Credit. There, all the regular employees ignore her, so she becomes friendly with three other temps: socializing actress Paula (Lisa Kudrow), conceited Jane (Alanna Ubach) and rebellious Margaret (Parker Posey). Though Margaret pines for a permanent job with the company, a rash of office thefts makes people suspicious of her, and Iris wonders whether or not to stand behind her new friend.

reviews: You just want to shake these four twits out of their collective, weirdly unsubstantiated malaise.
Insightful and well-acted comedy of inter-office angst.
Like the unrelenting Musack that fills the heroines's offices, Clockwatchers is a bit too sedate. If you don't watch carefully, you'll miss half the fun.
Expertly captures the drudgery of 9-5 office gigs
Complex characterization makes Clockwatchers a far more interesting picture than it would have been as a simple, breezy comedy.
A bold drama about the strange and often outrageous things that happen in the work-a-day world.
This is a rare film about the way people actually live.
This keenly observed and darkly comic indie is named for a quartet of office temps who toil at Global Credit while receiving no credit of their own.
A gem of a small movie.
